contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|blind spot}} '''Blind spot''' may refer to: In '''[[ophthalmology]]''': *[[Scotoma]], an obscuration of the visual field *[[Optic disc]], also known as the anatomical blind spot, the specific region of the retina where the optic nerve and blood vessels pass through to connect to the back of the eye *[[Blind spot (vision)]], also known as the physiological blind spot, the specific scotoma in the visual field that corresponds to the lack of light-detecting photoreceptor cells on the optic disc In '''culture''': *''[[The Blind Spot]]'' (1921), an early science fiction novel by Homer Eon Flint and Austin Hall *''Blind Spot: Hitler's Secretary'', the English title of ''[[Im toten Winkel]]'' (2002)—an Austrian documentary about Traudl Junge, the last personal secretary of Adolf Hitler *[[Blind Spot (1947 film)|''Blind Spot'' (1947 film)]], a 1947 film noir *[[Blind Spot (film)|''Blind Spot'' (1958 film)]], a 1958 film *[[Blind Spot (Hallmark)|''Blind Spot'' (Hallmark)]], a 1993 presentation in the [[Hallmark Hall of Fame]] *''Blind Spot'', a 2008 documentary on peak oil by [[Adolfo Doring]] *The effect an unshielded view of hyperspace has on the human optic nerve, in the [[Known Space]] universe *[[Blindspot]], a fictional character in the Marvel Comics universe '''Other uses''': *[[Blind spot (vehicle)]], areas outside of the vehicle that cannot be seen while looking forward or through optical aids. *[[Blind spot (psychology)]], a subject about which one is prejudiced or ignorant, such as a [[Bias blind spot]] *[[Antenna blind cone]], a blind spot of the antenna *[[Blind Spot (Law & Order: Criminal Intent)|"Blind Spot" (''Law & Order: Criminal Intent'')]], an episode of ''Law & Order: Criminal Intent'' *[[Blind Spot (Homeland)|"Blind Spot" (''Homeland'')]], an episode of the TV series ''Homeland'' *Can also refer to a location in a place with surveillance cameras that is not in view of any camera. ==See also== *[[Lacuna (disambiguation)]] *[[Blindspott]], a New Zealand band *[[Johari Window]], a Metaphorical Tool {{disambig}}
